text: UPDATED: JUL 9, 2015 Clear yellow, lasting white foam head. Small hoppy aro,a, quite bitter taste. Short aftertaste. (Lille 201507)
From handpump at La Capsule in Lille, with KL, AKH and GH. Hazy golden. Dense and persistent off-white head. Fruity and slightly spicy aroma of mango and citrus. Similar taste. Well-balanced.

From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is earthy and toasted malty. Light fruity. Toasted malty. Vague bretty. Bitter and slight fruity. Toasted mslty into the finish. Bitter and dry finish.
Geur van citrus en ander fruit. Niet erg uitgesproken, eigenlijk té mild en minder fris dan je zou willen of verwachten.

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 25 Oct 2014) Golden colour with foamy, white head. Malty, slightly fruity nose with bread, grass, floral hops, citrus and grain. Malty taste with notes of bread, grass, floral hops, grainy malt and a balanced citric/floral bitterness. Light to medium body, quite dry. A bit unbalanced, the light malt structure doesnt really support the hops. Still, refreshing and quite enjoyable.

Bottle from the source, thnx to sam. 
Pours unclear blonde small white head 
Smell is yeast, bitterhop. 
Corny malts. 
Taste is bitter, corny malts. Nice and refreshing.

Draft @ ML Fontainas.
Léger orangé, col blanc cassé peu tenace et laissant qcq bulles éparses.
Arôme au bouquet assez différent rappelant une sorte de grains fermentés, paille humide accompagnés de notes pains et un léger rétro-nasal fruité ici aussi assez anglais noble. 
Palais met demblée laccent sur un houblonné anglais proche du Fuggle et EKG sur des pointes maltées apportant également une bonne balance de Marris et un léger biscuité. Le tout garde des notes de moût qui me font penser au meert. Joserai maventurer à dire que cette version est plus agréable que de nombreuses bitter venant doutre-Manche.

On tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Slightly hazy golden/amber with a medium bubbly white head and little lacing. Aroma is of light caramel, mineral notes and light herbal presence. Taste is very similar with a light earthy bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Earthy finish. Its what you can expect from an average English Pale Ale. Not bad, but boring.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Clear gold pour with thin cask head. Aroma is malty, really leafy hops, something a bit vegetal. Taste is bitter, really leafy, light tea notes. Palate is dry light carbonation. Ok.

25 cl. draft @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Dark amber, big soapy, vanishing sparse bubbles head. Nose is soapy orange, light bitter metal. Soapy bitter orange, biscuit taste, very UK, oily, light grass finish, bergamot oil, orange peel. Low carbonation, almost cask body. Nothing stellar but soild UK-profile beer with a slightly odd not entirely there edge to it.

From draft at Moeder Lambic Fontainas Brussels. Clear amber with a patchy loose white head.
Stew-y / wort-like cara malt aroma: seeds, apple, spice, flowers, a dusty yeast quality. Medium body, semi-sweet, medium acid, medium bitterness, low carbonation. Sits flabby on the tongue and the finish is watery.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic, Fortainas. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, light yeast, hops, grass and flowers. Flavor is malty, yeast, grassy hops, light fruit, peach. Medium body, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. 310714

On cask @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: hazy pale blond beer with medium carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: nice grassy and bitterness nose. With fruity notes as peach and apricot. Taste: good grassy taste with nice dry bitterness. Water sensation on mouth, really fresh. Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: nice sweet bitterness with grassy sensation. Good collaboration, easy drinkable.
Amber with medium light yellow cap. Mild aroma, mild taste. Light bitterness with more bitter aftertaste on the second half of tongue root.
